bill.title: Relating to elections; declaring an emergency.
bill.description: Defines "qualified designated voter registration agency." Directs qualified designated voter registration agencies to provide Secretary of State with age, residence and citizenship data and digital signature of each person who meets qualifications set by secretary by rule. Directs secretary to register to vote each nonregistered person who is qualified to vote and to notify persons how to cancel registration and how to adopt or change political party affiliation. Increases maximum number of electors in precinct from 5,000 to 10,000. Allows person who is at least 16 years of age to register to vote. Establishes July 1, 2015, as date for determination of total number of registered electors in this state for purpose of maintaining status as minor political party for 2016 general election. Declares emergency, effective on passage.

history.action: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
